reply.label: Reply
reply.text: Bot will send commands responses as reply

profile.showMeOnLanding: Show me as streamer on landing

regenerateApiKey.info: This key is used for all overlays links, so when you regenerating this – you need to recreate overlays in your streaming software acording new links.

deleteConfirmation.text: Are you sure you want to delete this thing?

haveNoAccess.message: You are not authorized to view this page, ask broadcaster to provide it.

validations.startsWith: Command name should not start with !
validations.len: Command name should be less than 25 characters

validations.empty: Response should not be empty. Command can be created without responses, so you can omit this field.
validations.len: Response should be less than 500 characters

responses.defaultWarning: Responses cannot be edited for default commands

permissions.name: Roles
permissions.placeholder: Select roles, which will have permissions to use commands
permissions.deniedUsers: Users, who cannot use that command
permissions.allowedUsers: Users, who can bypass roles restriction for that command

restrictions.name: Restrictions by stats
restrictions.watchTime: Required watch time for use that command
restrictions.messages: Required messages for use that command
restrictions.channelsPoints: Required used channels points for use that command

visible.label: Visibility
visible.text: Command visibility on a public commands list page.

keepOrder.label: Keep order of responses
keepOrder.text: Bot will keep specified order of respones when sending them into chat

onlineOnly.label: Only while online
onlineOnly.text: This command will work only when the stream is online

alert.label: Select alert, which will be triggered on command usage

botManage.title: Bot Management
botManage.moderator: {botName} is a moderator on this channel.
botManage.notModerator: We have found that the bot is not a moderator on this channel. Please, use /mod {botName}, otherwise bot will not send messages in chat.

integrations.songServicesInfo: Logging in through streaming services such as last.fm, Spotify, VK will automatically print your currently playing song into chat when !song command is being used.
integrations.donateServicesInfo: Provides possibility to Twir for listen incoming donations, and setup interactions for you in {events}, {chatAlerts}, {overlaysRegistry} systems

discord.description: Use this integration for setup live alerts into your discord guilds

alerts.label: Alerts
alerts.channelsSelect: Select channels where notifications will be located
alerts.streamOnlinePlaceholder: The message twir will send when stream started
alerts.streamOfflinePlaceholder: The message twir will send when stream goes offline
alerts.updateAlert: Twir will update embed periodically to make sure embed in sync with your stream state (viewers, title, category, e.t.c)
alerts.shouldDeleteMessageOnOffline: Delete announce message instead of editing when stream becomes offline
alerts.additionalUsersIdsForLiveCheck: Additional twitch users for watch streams and send alerts

discord.cannotSendMessage: Bot has no access to send messages in that channel

faceit.info: Provides possibility to Twir track your faceit matches, and setup command variables such as $(faceit.elo), $(faceit.lvl) and much more.

valorant.info: Provides possibility to Twir track your valorant matches, and setup command variables such as $(valorant.profile.elo), $(valorant.profile.tier) and much more.

events.onlineOnly: Execute only when the stream is online

inputs.vipSlots: Your twitch channel VIP slots count

obs.warningTitle: You have to configure OBS first before proceeding further
obs.warningText: Seems like you have not connected Twir with OBS. Please, do it on “Overlays” page.

variables.userName: Name of the user who triggered the event
variables.userDisplayName: User display name who triggered the event
variables.commandInput: Parameters of command. Example someone used '!hello world' - and world is parameters there
variables.keywordResponse: Responses of keyword, joined by space
variables.pollOptionsNames: Options of poll, joined by comma
variables.pollWinnerChannelsPointsVotes: Channel points votes of poll winner
variables.pollWinnerTotalVotes: Total votes of poll winner. It includes bits and channel points votes
variables.predictionOptionsNames: Options of prediction, joined by · symbol
variables.predictionTotalChannelPoints: Total used channel points for prediction

predictionWinner.title: Title of winner option
predictionWinner.totalUsers: Total users who voted for winner option
predictionWinner.totalPoints: Total used channel points for winner option
predictionWinner.topUsers: Top 10 users who voted for winner option

variables.moderatorDisplayName: Moderator display name, who triggered action
variables.banEndsInMinutes: Ban in minutes, or "permanent" if permanent ban

overlays.noAccess: You cannot copy overlays of other users
overlays.copied: Copied overlay link url, paste it in obs as browser source

tts.description: Play audios in your OBS with some set of preconfigured voices. You can use that overlay via commands, or on events
tts.eventsHint: Hint: you can use events system to trigger tts on reward.
tts.allowUsersChooseVoice: Allow users use different voices in main (!tts) command
tts.doNotReadTwitchEmotes: Do not read Twitch emotes, including 7tv, FFZ, BTTV
tts.readChatMessages: Read all chat messages in overlay
tts.readChatMessagesNicknames: Read nicknames when reading chat messages
tts.disallowedVoices: Disallowed voices for usages in !tts voice command

users.empty: No one's created their own customizations yet.

tts.previewText: Preview voice with text, pitch, rate

obs.description: This overlay used for connect Twir with your obs. It gives opportunity to bot manage your sources, scenes, audio sources on events

alerts.description: This overlay used to play configured alerts

chat.description: Embed chat overlay into your streaming software
chat.hideCommands: Hide commands, do not include messages started with ! symbol
chat.directionWarning: For right and left directions you should set small height (about 50px) for overlay in your streaming software

kappagen.description: Liven up your screen with explosions, movements, fireworks, walls of emoticons
kappagen.info: Spawn will show emotes on screen while users just chatting, kappagen fires on command or configured events

settings.spawn: Spawn emotes on screen on each chat message
settings.time: The time an emote stays on screen

main.label: Main settings

startCommand.example:
!brb 1 Coffee – starts 1 minute countdown with 'Coffee' text
!brb 1 – starts 1 minute coundown with default text

stopCommand.description: Stops countdown and removes from screen

main.text: Text which will be showed on screen

late.label: Late settings
late.text: Text which will be showed on screen

player.title: Current song
player.noAccess: Player available only on your dashboard, you cannot listen songs requests on other users dashboards

settings.onlineOnly: Accept requests only when stream online
settings.neededPercentageForskip: Needed percentage of online users to skip song
settings.deniedWords: Denied words in song title and author
settings.takeSongFromDonationMessage: Takes song links from donation message

users.minimalWatchTime: Minimal watch time for request song (minutes)
users.minimalFollowTime: Minimal follow time for request song (minutes)

songs.maxRequests: Maximum number of songs in queue
songs.minLength: Min length of song for request (minutes)
songs.maxLength: Max length of song for request (minutes)
songs.minViews: Minimal views on song for request

modal.timelineDescription: One response will be sent once every N intervals, example:

keywords.title: Keywords
keywords.regularDescription: Regular expression should be written for golang!

variables.title: Variables
variables.info: When you create variable, then you can use them in bot responses.

info.title: Greeting system used for welcoming new users typed their first message on stream.
info.text: If you wanna greet every user in chat, not only specified - then you can use events system.

alerts.title: Alerts
alerts.info: You can create alert, and then assign it to command/event.
alerts.overlayLabel: Do not forget to insert overlay into your streaming software (i.e OBS)!
alerts.name: Name

validations.name: Name cannot be empty and bigger then 30 symbols

8ball.description: Ask the magic 8ball a question and it will answer you.

russianRoulette.description: Test luck in classic russian funny* roulette game.
russianRoulette.canBeUsedByModerator: Timeout moderators? Will remove mod -> timeout -> mod again.
russianRoulette.timeoutSeconds: Time for timeout (seconds). Leave as 0 if you want to disable timeout.
russianRoulette.initMessage: First message sended by bot, to announce trigger is pulled.
russianRoulette.deathMessage: Message, if user lost and timeouted.
russianRoulette.chargedBullets: Charged bullets in revolver (size of tumber is {tumberSize}). The bigger number - the biggest chance to die.

bothDie.title: Both die
bothDie.description: When both users dead in duel. Available variables: {'{target}, {initiator}'}

settings.title: Settings
settings.bothDiePercent: Percent of chance both users die

reset.resetQuestion: Are you sure you want to reset {title}?

overlaysRegistry.description: This system allows you to create custom confirugurable overlays for OBS. Currently it support only html overlays, but we'll add more for you. <3

noLayersCreated.title: Not configured
noLayersCreated.description: Currently layers of overlays not created

overlaysRegistry.name: Name of overlay

validations.name: Name cannot be empty and bigger then 30 symbols
validations.layers: Layers cannot be empty and it cannot contain more then 15 layers

html.description: Allows you to use custom html, css, and bot variables
html.updateInterval: Interval, in which html variables will be updated

variablesAlert.title: You can use some variables in html, click the button for show available options
variablesAlert.selectToCopy: Select variable, to copy it to clipboard

html.periodicallyRefetchData: Periodically parse html data from server

chatAlerts.randomMessageWithCount: Message will be randomed for identical count.
chatAlerts.replacedInfo: {vars} – will be replaced with actual information.

ban.alertInfo: Set time to 0 to print message on permanent ban.

moderation.warningMaxCount: Count of warnings before timeout user
moderation.excludedRoles: Select roles, which will be not impacted for this filter

links.name: Links
links.description: Scans Twitch chat for any web links or URLs and promptly removes them to prevent spam or unsafe content from being shared.

deny_list.name: Deny list
deny_list.description: Helps maintain a clean chat by filtering out words or phrases specified in a predefined list, preventing them from being displayed.
deny_list.empty: List of denied words is empty, please add atleast one
deny_list.regexp: Thats support regexp for advanced users. Note: it should be writted for golang

symbols.name: Symbols
symbols.description: Identifies and restricts excessive use of symbols, preventing clutter and maintaining readability in the chat.
symbols.triggerLength: From what message length start to check on symbols
symbols.maxPercentage: Max percent of symbols in message

long_message.name: Long message
long_message.description: Controls chat clutter by limiting the length of messages

caps.name: Caps
caps.description: Discourages excessive use of capital letters, promoting a more balanced and respectful conversation in the chat.
caps.maxPercentage: Maximum percent of capitalized letters in message
caps.triggerLength: Message length for start checking on caps

emotes.name: Emotes
emotes.description: Emotes moderation manages the frequency and volume of emoticons used in messages, avoiding overuse and spam of iconic emotes.

language.name: Language
language.description: Scans and filters out offensive or inappropriate languages.
